Take your seats kids and let me tell you a story about one hell of gaming experience I received in Mid-2000s during my first playthrough of Half-Life 2 (you might also put on play its soundtrack on Youtube while reading it, for example tracking device track). I was a teenager back then and this game reshaped perception of videogames for my whole generation. There was simply nothing on the similar level in those days and it's very hard to describe with words that very experience. Half-Life 2 revolutionized everything - storytelling, gameplay, artdirection,... It was so breathtaking. Graphics and physics of this game were on a brand new level for the whole industry and no one has seen anything like this before. One of most important things about Half-Life 2 is that it used technological innovations the way they served atmosphere and immersion so perfect, that the gamer was simply "drowning" in the game while immersing himself in this fictional but yet so believable world created by Valve. Going even further into ideas and standards set by the original Half-Life, Gabe Newell & Co opened to us a brand new chapter in the adventures of Gordon Freeman, a theoretical physicist and one of very few survivors of Black Mesa incident, but this time they introduced to gamers also many new characters. Thanks to technological breakthrough of Source Engine which gave us new level of face animations and ragdoll technology, we saw very much alive and believable humans on our screens. And so, we quickly fell in love with most of them. Barney Calhoun, Isaac Kleiner, Eli Vance, even terrifying  G-Man... But especially Alyx!.. It's where "falling in-love words" were reaching a special level indeed. This girl is one of most iconic female characters in video game industry and she really deserves to hold such title. So, I could go on but to conclude this review I want to say that while understanding that it's extremely difficult to describe experience Half-Life 2 gave us to brand new generations of gamers since many years have passed and progress obviously wasn't standing at one place, I tried really hard while doing it. So, I just want you to know that I wish you to play this game and really like it in case you never did it before.

don't you ever think that oh this is an old game and it's unplayable. if you love games and playing them, you have to play this game with out any question. this game belongs to the time when developers made games with passion, creativity. it's sad that was a long time ago, when you play games like these you learn something and that is beauty of it, making game in that time was meaningful, now what we are just loads of cash cow to them. just play it and enjoy.

I don't understand how valve employees made this masterpiece without knowing how to count to 3.
Amazing Game. This Is A MUST HAVE in order to experience the game that greatly influenced gaming history. Better Than Many Games Released Nowadays. Become GORDON FREEMAN!

Made during the golden era of Valve, Half-Life 2 is a technical, visual and storytelling masterpiece. With gameplay both being exciting and fast paced yet chilling and dreary. Half-Life 2 is not a typical First-person shooter, There is also a very intuitive puzzle aspect with physics mechanics being a core aspect of gameplay. The environments are visually incredible and beautiful, With tons of effort poured into creating an immersive and expansive landscape. And this showcases the true power of the Source engine. And for 2004 this game was groundbreaking and is still impressive today.
Best sequel to any game ever made

Played it for the first time in 2021.
This is good game, you should play it if you care for classics and history of video games. At times it is frustrating, at times it is archaic (especially in the era of Titanfalls and DOOMs and alike) but it still holds relatively well. The story is pretty minimalistic, till the end I wasn't really sure who are these guys I'm shooting and whether it's really the right thing to do. On the other side, this peculiar eerie atmosphere from the 1st one is still there, so is the feeling we're playing homage to being a nerd (Freeman is theoretical physicist after all, which is mentioned all the time). 
Overall I think I've liked the 1st part better, but this is still worth playing after all these years too. At the time it was released I can imagine it was completely mind-blowing.
come on everyone knows that this is an amazing game.
